intro: Hydrangea scandens subsp. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese climbing hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that can be blue, pink, or white, depending on soil pH. The plant produces opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its climbing habit allows it to be trained on trellises or fences, adding vertical interest to landscapes.
